p: Across sites, mean nest depth was 40.3 ± 4.7 cm (range = 27–61, n = 1,836 nests), with shallower depth in clutches protected in situ (39.3 ± 4.0 cm, n = 108) and relocated on the beach (39.2 ± 5.1, n = 71) than in hatcheries (40.4 ± 4.7 cm, n = 1,657). Nest depth was shallower at Bahía de Jiquilisco than Estero Padre Ramos (Table 2), with significant differences among protection strategies at both sites (Table 3).
